Author: Regnar#6164
Content: "The Microsoft Network failed because it was just one more walled garden. One that was walled-off in two ways. One was from a business standpoint, of trying to keep users locked into it and locked off from the rest of the world. But the other was the technical standpoint. It wanted to make it look like the Network was something you had control over, something you could interact with just like you could with your own data. And it was a lovely idea, but that's all it ever was. The thing itself was never more than a facade. Meanwhile those Internet nerds were off pasting hyperlinks around, doing wreckless things like setting up their own email addresses and adding new things to the network without having to ask anyone first. And despite The Microsoft Network making every object look so real on the outside that you could just squeeze it and watch the AddRefs ooze out, the Web's simple idea of giving every thing a unique readable location won by a mile. It wasn't the Object Oriented dream we might have hoped for, but Open Always Wins."

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: ha yea I understand your point Joe, and with some specific marketing it may work well. I am thinking that if we charge for listings, teams are forced to prioritize their funds which could take us out of the running for them. The listing fees themselves I don't think are much of a priority for Komodo as much as getting liquidity through the DEX where we generate dex fees from.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: My thought a while back and still think it would be better suited for MM2, would be to make a form on our website with those basic requirements jl just listed, plus a few more like contact information for an actual team member (if we have problems with their stuff) and some of the Icon work and social media contact info. This way it's crazy easy to list (just fill it out) and we make joint social media announcements with each new coin to help spread awareness of Komodo and the DEX.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: This additional contact info can also be used for us to reach out to them and request they provide LP's if they can.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Some additional products could be creating Agama and BarterDEX like white labels, and selling customized team skins for projects when they list. like if Xcoin submits for a listing, we could reach out and say we're listing on the DEX for free (and maybe OUR version of Agama) but we could also say we can customize a Xcoin themed skin Agama for a price, and maybe even an Xcoin themed BarterDEX skin. Something like when if they wanted the multicoin wallet with their theme, we basically have it so on opening it has Agama Logo and Xcoin logo and maybe some of their colors (they provide hex#), and it loads up with Xcoin, Komodo, and Bitcoin or something at start, has Jumblr feature built in, etc. 
That way they can get their coin users to download and use it, explore Jumblr, BarterDEX, Agama etc without feeling like they are pushing Komodo products on their users, we instead use BarterDEX, Agama, Jumblr as features and independent brands. It feels more in-house, and not "Komodo" but really it's all running on Komodo engines.
